page.title: 07ST. MARY'S CH. HORTON KIRBY
page.content: The Domesday Survey records a {Horton Kirby Church}in 1086. Parts of the present building date from c.1225. The nave was rebuilt early 14th Century. The tower was rebuilt in 1816,the chancel and porch halved in length in 1821. The result is a unique building. It displays trade skills and crafts over 700 years. However, it is not a museum. It is the spiritual centre of the community. Despite its civil cares having been curtailed legally, the Church permeates local life from birth to death. In a parish of approx. 3,000 pop. there are on average 32 baptisms, 23 funerals and 10 weddings each year. There is a Church School of 240 pupils. The Church is alive and growing. It is only through its work that ages to come will hear the Gospel of Jesus Christ, the Son of God.
